channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Naval Nuclear Propulsion Officer Candidate (NUPOC) Info Session | March 13
item.description: Date: Thursday, March 13, 2025 12:00 AM - 2:00 AM - Join us for an informational meeting about opportunities within the premier nuclear organization in the world and earning up to $180,000 while finishing your degree. Pizza will be provided. All students welcome! Doors will be open from 6:00-8:00 PM.
item.author: Students

item.title: Game Development Club Presents Analog GameJam!
item.description: We’re shaking things up! Join the RPI Game Development Club in Sage 2411 (VAST) for an out-of-the-box Game Jam, and make an Analog Game in 48 hours! Overnight breaks begin at 10:00 PM on both Friday and Saturday nights, and doors re-opening at 8:00 AM each morning. This event is open to RPI students of all majors and all levels of experience! Please contact club president, Aiden Crossfield (crossa2@rpi.edu) for more information and to sign up.
item.author: Students

item.title: Graduate Research Symposium Call for Abstracts | Due March 14
item.description: All graduate students are invited to submit abstracts for poster, podium, and/or artwork for the 10th Annual Graduate Research Symposium, scheduled for Friday, April 11. Deadline to submit abstracts is Friday, March 14.
item.author: Students

item.title: Review the Master of Engineering in Mechanical Engineering with Rensselaer at Work | March 26
item.description: Wednesday, March 26, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work faculty on a 30-minute information session covering Rensselaer’s online, project-based Master of Engineering program in Mechanical Engineering. Experienced engineers are asked to take on larger and more complex tasks as they progress in their careers, and this program provides the necessary breadth and depth, no matter where one’s career takes them. Please register…

item.title: Lally Accelerated Eng/Sci + MBA Program Virtual Info Session | March 13
item.description: Join the Lally School of Management on Thursday, March 13 at 11:00 AM to explore the exciting updates to RPI’s Accelerated Eng/Sci + MBA Program! This is a unique opportunity for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd-year engineering and science students to fast-track their careers and earnings potential by completing an MBA alongside their undergraduate degree—saving both time and money. Register for an information session.
item.author: Students

item.title: Applications for the CCPD Peer Career Advisor program are open!
item.description: RPI’s Center for Career and Professional Development (CCPD) is seeking energetic, positive, proactive students to fill Peer Career Advisor (PCA) positions. This position is $16/hour and will be assisting students with career-related topics such as resumes and cover letters, LinkedIn, and internship and job search basics. Apply by Sunday March 16!
item.author: Students

item.title: Arch Program Summer 2025 Important Dates & Information
item.description: There are some important dates coming up for the Arch Summer Program! Be sure you stay informed about key deadlines and requirements. Visit the official Arch Calendar for details! Looking for a personalized pathway for the summer? The Arch integrates experiential learning into your undergraduate experience. With flexible options to suit your needs, you can choose a timeline that works best for your academic and career goals.

item.title: RPIrates Monthly Meeting: “Ready for Prime Time: How to Deploy Shiny Apps!” | March 12
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 6:00pm in AE217. Topic will be “Ready for Prime Time: How to Deploy Shiny Apps!” led by Dr. John Erickson, Director of Research Operations for the Future of Computing Institute (FOCI) at Rensselaer and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. In this session we’ll review coding Shiny apps in R and Python, how to test apps internally on the FOCI Cluster, and how to robustly deploy with Docker and ShinyProxy.

item.title: Wellness Wednesday
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Recharge midweek with Wellness Wednesdays! Stop by for rotating wellness activities like meditation, free snacks, creative crafts, and more. Open to all—take a break and prioritize you!
item.author: Community

item.title: Retrospective: Tara Rodgers carries listeners through deeply felt sonic energy
item.description: Date: Friday, March 14, 2025 6:00 PM - Tara Rodgers produces a concert of selected works from the past 25 years, diffused in an immersive 4.1 sound system. Join us and thrill in her deeply connected soundscapes that embody joy, transcendence, and positivity—from generative computer music written in SuperCollider, to electroacoustic compositions featuring piano improvisation, to pulsing ambient and techno tracks. After the concert, DJ Rekha Malhotra and Stephanie Loveless lead a conversation and Q&A with the artist.

item.title: C&M Colloquium with Calum Matheson to be held on March 12
item.description: Please join the Communication and Media Department on Wednesday, March 12th from 2pm-4pm for a seminar titled “The Limits of Mediation and Opportunities for Communication and Media” by Dr. Calum Matheson, Chair of the Department of Communication at the University of Pittsburgh and faculty at the Pittsburgh Psychoanalytic Center.

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group Monthly Meeting | March 12
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 4 pm - 5 pm. The group gives researchers, academics, and administrative staff a place to discuss algorithms, share coding experiences, and stay informed about research and development projects that are being conducted both on and off campus. All are welcome! If you are interested in presenting please contact Tom Morgan at morgat5@rpi.edu

item.title: Fact vs. Rhetoric: Know Your Rights | March 12
item.description:
Wednesday, March 12, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM - Join ISSS for a conversation with Cianna Freeman-Tolbert, Partner at Whiteman Osterman & Hanna LLP, to discuss facts about current immigration issues in higher education and how it relates to the RPI community. This event is open to all members of campus community with an active RPI ID.
